722115f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722115f-a.text:
park Ave., east side, south from 41st Street, during the construction
of the Lexington Ave. Subway. The 41st Street pedestrian overpass has been
temporarily taken down. On the right, appears a portion o the Murray
Hili Hotel.
April 5, 1901.

722192f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722192f-a.text:
Grand Union Hotel, Park Avenue, east side, from 4lst to 42nd
Streets, also showing the new Grand Central Station ano the
old spur of the Third Avenue Elevated, which will be taken down
in 1944.
The Grand Union was to a great extent built by acquistion of old
ouses in the block, intervening walls being knocked out and roons
remodelled. The whole is shown shortly before demolition. Com-
Dare this with later pictures of the same block.
1914.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

722561f-a.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street (East)
722561f-a.text:
Pershing Scuare (Park Avenue), east side, from East 41st
(right) to 42nd (left),Street's, showing the Grand Union
HNotel of the 1890's. This structure was demolished in
the Summer of 1914, and was later replaced with the pre-
sent Pershing Square Building. The 40th-42nd Street area
acquired this designation in honor of the dommander in
Chief of the American Expeditionary Force in France about
this time. It was originally Fourth Avenue, a section of
which was changed to Park Avenue.
About 1914
Gift of Urbrock Collection
NA1 ' 221

722562f-a.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street (East)
722562f-a.text:
Pershing Scuare (Park Avenue), east side, from East 41st
(right) to 42nd (left) Street's, showing the Grand Union
Hotel of the 1890's. This structure was removed in the
Summer of 1914. Upon this site was erected the Pershing
Square Building. Note the Architects Building on the
right margin; the absence of the automobile viaduct over
the Avenue; and the old "El" spur on 42nd Street.
About 1914
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection

722189f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722189f.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 41st to 442nd Streets, the side entrance
to the Hotel Belmont, at Pershing SGuare.
Probably late 1918.
.0  NN 25 A207

722193f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722193f.text:
Park Avenue, east side, from 41st to 42nd Streets, on Pershing
Sduare, where the Grand Union Hotel stood until June, 1914,
showing the new Grand Central Station ano the recently commpleted
Hotel Commodore on the north side of 42nd Street, also the old
elevated spur used until 1923 as a shuttle to the Third Avenue
line. The covered stairways in the vacant lot are entrances to
the express station of the new east side Interborough Subway,
which was opened in the summer of 1918.
About 1919.
0ift of E. M. Jenks.

722190f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722190f.text:
Pershing Souare, Park Avenue from 4lst to 42nd Streets, looking west
at the Hotel Belmont (1906-31) from the vacant lot where the
Grand Union Hotel used to stand and where the Pershing Square build-
ing will be erected. The name Pershing Square, after 0eneral Pershing.
com.ander of the Aumerican Expeditonary Force, was applied to this olocz
about the time of the Armistice.
The Pershing Scuare viaduct, shown here, conducted automobile traftic
from Park Avenue and 40th Street across 42nd Street and around the
left side of the Grand Central Station to Vanderbilt Avenue and 45th
Street. As shown here it is quite new. The covered stairway coming
up out of the vcant lot in the foreground is an entrance to the new
Lexington Avenue Interborough Subway, opened in the sumuer of 1918.
On the S.V. corner of Glst Street may be seen part of the old Murray
Hill Hotel; and west on 42nd Street the Hotel Manhattan on the N. W.
corner of Madison Avenue, later to be remodelled into an office build-
ing and uptown office for the National City Bank. The small building
on the N. E. corner of Madison Avenue and 42nd Street is shortly to be
demolished and replaced by the Liggett Drug building.
About 1920.

722119f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722119f-a.text:

Irving Underhill.
0ift of York & Sawyer.

722120f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722120f-a.text:
Excavwtion for the Pershing Square Building, Park Avenue, east
side, from 4lst to 42nd Streets. The Grand Central Station is at
the extreme left. At the right is the Hotel Commodore. In front
of the two is the Park Avenue station of the 42nd Street spur of
the Third Avenue Elevated Railroad. This spur will be demolished
within two years.
June 26, 1922.
Irving Underhill.
Gift of York &. Sawyer.

which will be torn down in 1931, is seen in the foreground; at the
left is a bit of the Murray Hill Hotel, which, though considerably
older than the Belmont, will stand in 1936.

Irving Underhill.
qift of York & Sawyer.

722566f-c.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street
722566f-c.text:
(1)
Pershing Square, (Park Ave). west side, from East 42nd to 4lst
Streets. Also shown is the Murray Hill Hotel, at No. 112 Park Ave.,wes.
side, from East 41st to 40th Streets. Building shown under demolition
is the Hotel Belmont. This view is as seen from the Graybar Building and
across Grand Central Station; southward. Note the raised vehicular via-
duct at this point.
April 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing mainly the Hotel Belmont.
April 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

722563f.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street (East)
722563f.text:
Pershing Square (Park Ave.), west side, from East 41st (left) to
42nd (right) Streets, showing the Belmont Hotel. This building, erected
about 1906, was demolished in 1931. The site, today (1937) is stkll
vacant.
Prior to 1931.
International News Photos.

722560f-a.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street (East)
722560f-a.text:
Pershing SQuare, at the N.E. corner of East 41st Street, as seen view-
ing eastward on 41st Street, from a point just west of the west side of the
Square. Building shown, is the Pershing Scuare Building. Across its
roof apoears portions of the Chanin and Chrysler Buildings. Note the Vehi-
cular viaduct at this point.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

722195f.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 41st Street
722195f.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 42nd to 41st Streets, showing
th Hotel Belmont
Wurts Brothers  no date

722565f-c.title: Manhattan: Pershing Square - 41st Street
722565f-c.text:
(1)
Pershing Square (Park Ave)., west side, between 41st and 42nd Streets,
showing Outdoor Cafe and Bar.
June 24, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NEdd ~~ E8
(2)
The same, from a different angle, the Autumn before.
September 10, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, another view.
September 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
